newsitem.title: USA: Computer Data obtains $75 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Computer Data obtains $75 mln loan.

text.p: Computer Data Systems Inc said Tuesday it obtained a $75 million credit facility with NationsBank Corp.

Computer Data said it expects to draw upon the bulk of the term portion of the loan at the closing of its previously announced acquisition of Analytical Systems Engineering Corp for $51 million, scheduled for June 18.

The NationsBank credit facility is comprised of two basic loans. Computer Data will utilize a term loan of $50 million for the Analytical Systems acquisition and a revolving loan of $25 million for working capital, future acquisitions and general corporate objectives.
According to the loan agreement, the term loan amortizes over seven years with a balloon payment due at the end of five years. The revolving loan will expire in three years.

Analytical Systems is a privately held company headquartered in Burlington, Massachussetts, that provides engineering and technical services primarily for the intelligence community and to Department of Defense agencies.
Computer Data provides broad-based information technology solutions for government and commercial customers.
